direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve operations related to flexible loans, specifically borrowing and repaying, which are complementary actions.
Both methods handle loan repayments with similar control flows and parameter handling, differing only in the type of loan (flexible vs. standard).
The repayment history method depends on the successful execution of the repayment method, making it a logical candidate for test case enhancement.
Both methods manipulate loan-related data and share similar resource access patterns, such as interacting with loan and collateral coins.
Both methods may encounter similar exceptions related to loan operations, such as insufficient funds or invalid parameters.
